1.description: The sarcastic RainWing with deadly venom and color-changing scales. Feeling displaced after Tsunami's reunion with her family, she's determined to find her own tribe and heritage.

20.description: Becomes Queen of the RainWings after challenging the existing monarchy and proving her worth through trials. Takes on the responsibility of protecting both RainWings and NightWings.

relationships.Deathbringer: NightWing assassin who becomes her devoted protector

1.description: The loyal brown MudWing continues to support Glory as she searches for her place among the RainWings. His steady friendship provides comfort during her identity crisis.

relationships.Glory: Best friend whose quest he supports

1.description: The fierce SeaWing princess who recently reunited with her family. Now helps Glory search for the RainWing kingdom while dealing with her own complex feelings about family and duty.
The anxious NightWing scholar whose knowledge becomes crucial in finding both the RainWing village and the secret NightWing island. Struggles with loyalty to his birth tribe.

25.description: Forced to confront the truth about his NightWing heritage and the tribe's deception. Must choose between loyalty to his birth tribe and doing what's right.

1.description: The optimistic small SandWing who provides emotional support to Glory during her search for identity and belonging among the RainWings.

8.description: A cheerful pink-and-gold RainWing who becomes the dragonets' guide to the RainWing village. Laid-back and friendly, embodying typical RainWing peaceful nature.

18.description: Revealed to be Glory's half-brother, sharing the same father. This family connection helps Glory feel more grounded in RainWing society.

10.description: One of the RainWing queens who rules through a rotating monarchy system. Elderly and set in traditional RainWing ways of avoiding conflict and responsibility.

20.description: Loses the queenship challenge to Glory but becomes a valuable advisor, recognizing Glory's potential to lead the RainWings into a new era.

relationships.Glory: New queen she respects and advises

10.description: The most vain and self-centered of the RainWing queens, obsessed with her appearance and completely uninterested in the missing RainWings or any real problems.

relationships.Glory: Young dragon who challenges her authority

10.description: A RainWing queen who focuses on art and beauty rather than governance. More interested in creating lovely things than solving real problems facing her tribe.

relationships.Glory: Young dragon who disrupts her peaceful existence

9.description: A RainWing villager who lives in the canopy village. Like most RainWings, he's generally peaceful and laid-back, preferring to avoid conflict.

11.description: A dark green RainWing who is desperately worried about his missing partner Orchid. One of the few RainWings willing to take action about the disappearances.

relationships.Glory: Dragon he hopes will help find Orchid

11.description: A missing RainWing who disappeared weeks ago, causing great distress to her partner Mangrove. Her disappearance is part of a larger pattern the queens ignore.

24.description: Found imprisoned on the NightWing island, drugged and used as a test subject by NightWing scientists. Her rescue becomes part of Glory's larger mission.

relationships.Mastermind: NightWing scientist who experimented on her

9.description: A friendly RainWing who lives in the village and helps newcomers feel welcome. Represents the typical RainWing hospitality and peaceful nature.
A young RainWing living in the village who is curious about the visiting dragonets of destiny but maintains the typical RainWing easy-going attitude.

13.description: A small, energetic young RainWing with bright pink and yellow scales. Unlike most RainWings, she's curious and eager for adventure, quickly befriending Glory.

relationships.Glory: Older dragon she admires and follows
relationships.Mangrove: Adult who worries about missing dragons

24.description: Volunteers to help rescue the missing RainWings despite the danger, showing courage unusual for her typically peaceful tribe.

15.description: A black NightWing assassin sent to kill Glory, but becomes fascinated by her instead. Cocky and dangerous, but begins to question his orders as he gets to know her.

relationships.Morrowseer: Elder who gave him the assassination mission

25.description: Fully commits to protecting Glory and helping her save both tribes, abandoning his loyalty to the NightWing elders in favor of doing what's right.

relationships.Jambu: RainWing he learns to work with

16.description: The imposing NightWing elder who created the dragonet prophecy. His true motives begin to surface as he tries to control the situation with Glory and the RainWings.

25.description: Revealed as a fraud who made up the prophecy to serve NightWing interests. His lies and manipulation are exposed as Glory uncovers the truth about both tribes.

22.description: A NightWing scientist conducting experiments on captured RainWings. Cold and calculating, he represents the worst of NightWing arrogance and cruelty.

26.description: Revealed to be Starflight's father, adding personal stakes to the conflict between the NightWings and their victims.

20.description: A cheerful black NightWing dragonet who was raised as an alternative to Starflight. Optimistic and friendly, unlike most NightWings the dragonets have met.

relationships.Starflight: Dragon she was meant to replace

25.description: The secret NightWing queen who has been trapped in ice for years after a battle with an IceWing. Rules from the shadows while planning to take over the RainWing kingdom.

relationships.Greatness: Daughter who rules in her place
relationships.Glory: RainWing queen she wants to replace

25.description: Battlewinner's daughter who acts as queen while her mother is trapped in ice. Nervous and insecure, struggling with the weight of leadership.

relationships.Glory: RainWing queen who threatens her position

17.description: A NightWing assassin working with Deathbringer on missions for the NightWing leadership. More ruthless and loyal to the tribe than Deathbringer proves to be.

24.description: A NightWing warrior who serves Queen Battlewinner loyally. Participates in the tribe's plans to take over the RainWing territory.

25.description: An elder NightWing who serves in Battlewinner's council. Supports the plan to take over RainWing territory for the dying NightWing tribe.

23.description: A fierce NightWing dragonet who was part of the alternative set of dragonets created as backups to the prophecy. Aggressive and ambitious.

25.description: A NightWing who actually possesses the rare power of mind-reading, making her valuable to the tribe's leadership but also burdened by constantly hearing others' thoughts.

relationships.Glory: RainWing queen she learns to respect

25.description: A NightWing elder serving on Queen Battlewinner's council. Helps plan the invasion of RainWing territory as a solution to their dying homeland.

24.description: A NightWing scholar involved in the experiments and studies being conducted on captured RainWings. Represents the intellectual arrogance of the NightWing tribe.

26.description: A NightWing mother living on the volcano island, struggling with the harsh conditions and the tribe's desperate situation.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen whose policies affect her family

2.description: A pink-and-orange RainWing who lives in the village. Spends most days sunbathing and enjoying the peaceful life of the rainforest.

3.description: A young RainWing with bright green scales. Curious about Glory and the outside world, less content than older dragons with endless sunbathing.

4.description: A brown-scaled RainWing who is responsible for gathering fruit from the canopy. One of the few RainWings with regular duties.
A gentle green RainWing with healing knowledge. One of the few RainWings who actively helps others instead of just sunbathing.

5.description: An older RainWing with purple and white scales. More traditional in her views and skeptical of changes to RainWing peaceful lifestyle.

3.description: A creative RainWing who decorates the village with beautiful flower arrangements and natural art. Takes pride in making the village beautiful.

6.description: A RainWing who keeps track of village supplies and organizes community activities. More organized than most RainWings.

4.description: An orange-scaled RainWing who tells stories to young dragonets and keeps oral traditions alive in the village.

relationships.Tamarin: Young dragon she tells stories to

8.description: A yellow RainWing who is recruited by Glory to help scout for missing RainWings and guard against threats.

12.description: A green RainWing who becomes one of Glory's guards. Learns to be more alert and active under Glory's leadership.

5.description: A wise RainWing who teaches young dragonets about the rainforest and RainWing abilities like camouflage and venom.

3.description: A sleepy RainWing who embodies the tribe's relaxed lifestyle. Spends all day sunbathing and shows little interest in Glory's changes.

8.description: A fast-flying RainWing who becomes one of Glory's messengers, carrying news between RainWing groups.

4.description: A RainWing who prepares food for village gatherings. Skilled at finding and preparing the best fruits and plants.

3.description: A typical RainWing who loves sunbathing and sleeping. Represents the traditional RainWing way of life.

5.description: A RainWing who helps decorate the village for special occasions. Works with natural materials to create beautiful displays.

6.description: A grumpy RainWing who complains about Glory's changes to village life. Prefers the old ways of endless relaxation.

4.description: A young RainWing dragonet who is fascinated by Glory's stories of the outside world. More adventurous than most RainWings.

3.description: An extremely sleepy RainWing who naps most of the day. Even more lazy than typical RainWings.

8.description: A helpful RainWing who assists Glory with organizing the search for missing dragons. One of the more active villagers.

5.description: A RainWing who builds and maintains tree platforms and village structures. More industrious than most of his tribe.

relationships.Liana: Dragon whose healing hut he maintains

8.description: A observant RainWing who becomes one of Glory's lookouts, watching for NightWings and other threats.

6.description: An elderly RainWing with pale scales who remembers older times. Provides wisdom about RainWing history.

4.description: A RainWing who gathers medicinal plants and herbs for the village healer. Knowledgeable about forest plants.

13.description: A black NightWing soldier who patrols the volcanic island. Part of the force that captures and experiments on RainWings.
A powerful NightWing guard who helps capture RainWings for the experiments. Loyal to the NightWing cause.

14.description: A NightWing with mind-reading abilities who gathers intelligence for Queen Battlewinner. Uses her powers to spy on enemies.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen she serves with her mind powers

13.description: A fierce NightWing warrior who leads raids against other tribes. Driven by anger about the NightWings' situation.

14.description: A NightWing who keeps track of tribal secrets and sensitive information. Trusted with the tribe's most important knowledge.

15.description: An elderly NightWing who advises the queen and council. One of the few who remembers better times for the tribe.

14.description: A NightWing who uses her abilities to extract information from prisoners and captives. Skilled at reading minds and detecting lies.

15.description: A NightWing scientist who assists Mastermind with experiments on captured RainWings. Studies RainWing abilities.

13.description: A skilled NightWing tracker who hunts down escaped prisoners and tracks enemy movements. Expert at stealth.

19.description: A deadly NightWing assassin who works alongside Deathbringer on dangerous missions. Expert in poison and stealth kills.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen who sends them on missions

13.description: A NightWing captain who commands the island guards. Responsible for security on the volcanic island.

14.description: A gloomy NightWing who believes the tribe is doomed. Spreads despair and negativity throughout the island.

relationships.Secretkeeper: Dragon who tries to keep his complaints quiet

13.description: A NightWing who patrols the island at night, watching for threats and escape attempts. Works the dark hours.

15.description: A cruel NightWing who tortures prisoners and captives to break their spirits. Takes pleasure in causing suffering.
A NightWing who claims to have prophetic visions but actually just makes educated guesses. Pretends to have powers he lacks.

relationships.Wisdom: Elder who sees through his lies

16.description: A NightWing teacher who educated young dragons about NightWing history and traditions. More reasonable than most.

20.description: An ancient NightWing animus mentioned in tribal legends. His story serves as a warning about the dangers of animus magic.
A NightWing who will become important in the future. Currently works as an information keeper for the tribe.

14.description: A NightWing who keeps written records of tribal activities and experiments. Meticulous record keeper.

13.description: A fast-flying NightWing who carries messages between the island and NightWing agents in other kingdoms.

15.description: A hopeless NightWing who has given up on the tribe's survival. Believes they are all doomed to die on the volcano.

relationships.Battlewinner: Queen he has no faith in

15.description: A NightWing who studies the volcano and predicts its eruptions. Provides warnings about geological dangers.

recaps.1: Glory struggles with feeling displaced after Tsunami's family reunion and decides to search for her own tribe, the RainWings, hoping to find where she truly belongs.
recaps.2: The dragonets begin their journey to find the mysterious RainWing kingdom, which is supposedly hidden deep in the rainforest and difficult to locate.
recaps.3: Searching through the dense jungle, the dragonets encounter various obstacles and dangers while looking for any sign of the elusive RainWing village.
recaps.4: The group continues their quest through the rainforest, facing both natural hazards and their own doubts about whether they'll ever find Glory's tribe.
recaps.5: Glory's frustration grows as the search proves more difficult than expected, and she begins to wonder if the RainWings even want to be found.
recaps.6: The dragonets discover signs of dragon habitation in the rainforest but struggle to pinpoint the exact location of the RainWing settlement.
recaps.7: Clues finally lead the dragonets closer to the RainWing village, though they're still unsure exactly what they'll find when they arrive.
recaps.8: The dragonets meet Jambu, a friendly RainWing who becomes their guide to the hidden village built high in the rainforest canopy.
recaps.9: Glory and her friends arrive at the beautiful RainWing village, a treetop paradise where RainWings live peacefully among the branches and flowers.
recaps.10: Glory meets the RainWing queens - Grandeur, Magnificent, and Exquisite - who rule through a rotating monarchy but seem uninterested in real leadership.
recaps.11: The dragonets learn about Mangrove, a RainWing desperately searching for his missing partner Orchid, though the queens dismiss his concerns as unimportant.
recaps.12: Glory becomes increasingly frustrated with the RainWing queens' indifference to serious problems, including the mysterious disappearances of several tribe members.
recaps.13: Glory befriends Kinkajou, an energetic young RainWing, while continuing to investigate the missing dragons that the queens refuse to acknowledge.
recaps.14: The pattern of disappearances becomes clearer as Glory realizes that RainWings have been vanishing regularly, but no one in authority seems to care enough to investigate.
recaps.15: Glory encounters Deathbringer, a NightWing assassin sent to kill her, but instead of completing his mission, he becomes fascinated by her strength and determination.
recaps.16: Morrowseer appears and reveals more about the prophecy's true purpose while Deathbringer struggles with his conflicting loyalties between his mission and his growing respect for Glory.
recaps.17: Glory challenges the RainWing queens' authority and begins taking charge of investigating the disappearances, showing leadership qualities the lazy queens lack.
recaps.18: Glory learns that Jambu is her half-brother, giving her a family connection in the RainWing tribe while strengthening her resolve to protect her newfound people.
recaps.19: The investigation into the missing RainWings leads Glory closer to the truth about who is taking them and why the tribe's leadership has been so ineffective.
recaps.20: Glory challenges Queen Grandeur to trials for the crown and wins, becoming the new RainWing queen and gaining the authority to properly address the tribe's problems.
recaps.21: As the new queen, Glory begins organizing the RainWings to take action against whoever is responsible for the disappearances, despite their natural reluctance for conflict.
recaps.22: Glory and her allies discover that the NightWings have been kidnapping RainWings and using them as test subjects for cruel experiments.
recaps.23: The full scope of NightWing deception becomes clear as Glory realizes the tribe has been planning to take over RainWing territory while conducting horrific experiments.
recaps.24: Glory leads a rescue mission to save the captured RainWings, including Orchid, from the NightWing island where they're being held and tortured.
recaps.25: Glory confronts Queen Battlewinner and the NightWing leadership, exposing their lies about the prophecy and their plans to steal RainWing land.
recaps.26: The truth about Morrowseer's false prophecy is revealed as Glory uncovers the NightWing plot to use the dragonets as pawns in their scheme to abandon their dying homeland.
recaps.27: Glory must decide the fate of the NightWing tribe - whether to punish them for their crimes or offer them mercy and a chance to coexist peacefully with the RainWings.
recaps.28: Glory establishes herself as queen of both the RainWings and NightWings, creating a new alliance between the tribes while ensuring justice for past wrongs and hope for the future.
